configure.p: The ExperimentPreparator actor is a composite actor used inside the GAMESSNimrodRun composite actor, which is used in computational chemistry workflows. To see inside the actor, right-click it and select "Open Actor" from the menu.

To use the full suite of computational chemistry actors, GAMESS, Open Babel, Babel, and QMView software must be installed on the local system. In addition, the Nimrod/G part of the Nimrod toolkit for distributed parametric modeling must be installed.

Nimrod is a tool for scheduling and managing parametric experiments on the Grid, allowing scientists to easily and efficiently run a computational model and vary key object parameters (e.g., length, speed, etc). For more information about Nimrod, see http://www.csse.monash.edu.au/~davida/nimrod/

GAMESS (General Atomic and Molecular Electronic Structure System) is a program that can perform a broad range of quantum chemical computations. For more information about GAMESS, see http://www.msg.ameslab.gov/GAMESS/

property.name: port:output
property.configure: An output port that broadcasts the result of the actor's execution.

property.name: port:planFileHandle
property.configure: An input port that receives a file handle, which can be generated and output by the GAMESSPlanFileGenerator actor.

property.name: prop:ExperimentName
property.configure: The name of the experiment (e.g., gamess)

property.name: prop:ExperimentType
property.configure: The type of the experiment (e.g., G, O, or A)

property.name: prop:NimrodBinary
property.configure: The location of the Nimrod application (e.g., /opt/nimrodg-3.0.0/bin/nimrod)
